intro: Narcissus jonquilla subsp. willkommii, commonly known as the Willkomm narcissus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers with a distinct central cup. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically appearing after the flowers have bloomed. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is also valued for its resilience to mild winters and its role in pollination by bees and other insects.
